result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan M. Melcher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State files Information.
State indicates this case will be DRI.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:04 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan M. Melcher
Current: P.O. Box 505, 1320 Main St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 2873 Cty Tk O, Junction City, WI 54443
$10,000 sig bond - Comply with all existing conditions in all pending cases including Day report

FTR:  1:12:08
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of bail jumping - (missed [3] some appearances at Day Report).  
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.  Commissioner advises of right to not making any statements.  
Defendant makes statement to the court.  

Atty Drengler represents this defendant per ADA Knaapen.

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $10,000 sig bond - Comply with all conditions in all pending cases.
Defendant questions the DA re: day report.

BTC:
$10,000 sig bond - Comply with all existing conditions in all pending cases including Day report

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7-13-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
